results.contents:
Do you want to join usin helping to fight the world's most threatening diseases and enabling accessto care for more people around the world? At Siemens Healthineers, we pioneerbreakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere.

We offer you a flexibleand dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone inorder to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting?

Our global team: We area team of 66,000 highly dedicated employees across more than 70 countriespassionately pushing the boundaries of what's possible in healthcare to helpimprove people's lives around the world. As a leader in the industry, we aspireto create better outcomes and experiences for patients no matter where theylive or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio, spanning fromin-vitro and in-vivo diagnostics to image-guided therapy and innovative cancercare, is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

Our culture: We are partof an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers,professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what'spossible, to improve people's lives around the world. We embrace aculture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual canbe unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continuedsuccess. Check our Careers Site at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/careers.

What you'll do: Siemens Healthineers Velocity SalesAssociate (VSA) will work in partnership with field Account Executives (AEs) tocreate qualified leads that convert to pipeline and provide sales support tothe AE throughout the sales cycles. The VSA will develop pipeline throughoutbound prospecting and following up on sales leads targeted at non-hospitalcustomers (e.g., ambulatory surgery centers and imaging centers).Candidates will start their career on the team and will haveopportunities to learn and advance their career through mentorship and exposureto all aspects of the Siemens Healthineers business. The position willbe based in the Upstate New York Area, remote applicants within the area mayalso apply.

Who you'll work with:

  • Work directly with Regional Vice President of Sales and existing field Account Executives (AEs) in the region
  • Have frequent interaction with the Siemens Healthineers Networked Care strategy team

Responsibilities:

  • Produce Sales Qualified Leads (SQL) that convert to pipeline by conducting out-bound prospecting (cold-calls, email, social) and following-up on Marketing Qualified Leads (MQLs) of Ambulatory Surgery Centers and Imaging Centers
  • Qualify customers and prospects to meet SQL criteria
  • Consult with customers to identify theirneeds and pain points to identify product opportunities
  • Effectively use CRM system and othertools to plan calls to potential customers within region, record allactivities, and schedule appropriate follow-up tasks
  • Hand-off warm Sales Qualified Leads(SQLs) to field AEs
  • Meet daily, monthly, and quarterly KPImetrics and assist AEs in meeting sales quota
  • Stay informed and educated with Siemens Healthineers product and service information updates
  • Foster strong internal relationships to support fast and effective value-delivery tocustomers
  • Support AEs through the sales process with activities such as conducting clientresearch, compiling product communication material, leveraging internal SiemensHealthineers network to bring in relevant product support networks, completingmiscellaneous customer requests, etc.
  • Track insights on customer needs and communicate regularly with field AEs
  • Look for customer trends in theregion and proactively contribute to territory planning /coverage with AE's
  • Perform well-organized prospectingstrategies and weekly calls with all AE counterparts to discuss priorweek's activities and determine current week's strategy

What we are looking for:

  • Bachelor's Degree preferred, or equivalentcombination of education, training, & experience
  • Professional sales skills (written and oralskills) and a desire to further advance your sales skillset
  • Excellent communication skills; able to buildrelationships with key decision makers
  • Strong organizational skills and proactivityfollowing-up on leads
  • Resilient attitude, coachability anddemonstrated consistency in performance
  • Experience in the medical technology space
  • Able to determine customer's values / needs andrecommend Siemens Healthineers solutions & services
  • Excellent presentation, planning, andorganizational skills
  • Able to work in a team environment,performance-based culture
  • Advanced skills with Microsoft Office Suite:Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint
  • Able to leverage CRM to manage accounts;experience using CRM tools such as Oracle Sales Cloud or equivalent is a plus
  • Advanced skills with Microsoft Office Suite:Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint

Bonus characteristics:

  • Experience working in fast-paced salesenvironment, focused on top-of-funnel lead generation
  • Prior Medtech sales experience
  • Proven experience with conductinginbound/outbound phone calls

At Siemens Healthineers,we value those who dedicate their energy and passion to a greater cause. Ourpeople make us unique as an employer in the med-tech industry. What unites andmotivates our global team is the inspiration of our commonpurpose: To innovate for healthcare, building on our remarkablelegacy of pioneering ideas that translate into even better healthcare productsand services. We recognize that taking ownership of our work allows both us andthe company to grow. We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment and thespace to move beyond your comfort zone to grow both personally andprofessionally.

This job is based inthe New York/New Jersey Region. The base pay range for this position is Min$60,000- Max $70,000 plus a Targeted Annual Variable Pay of $65,000. Thepay wage range shown is based on the job posting's primary location. Actual compensationpackages are based on a wide array of factors, including but not limited toskill set, experience, certifications, and location.

If you want to join usin transforming the way healthcare is delivered, visit our career site at https://usa.healthcare.siemens.com/careers.

If you wish to find outmore about the specific before applying, please visit: https://usa.healthcare.siemens.com/about.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy toconsider applications from individuals with disabilities.

results.contents:
About us:

We'reSiemens. Award winning; Ranked on Fortune 500; Digital Engineering globalleader. A collection of over 300,000 excellent minds who are all making thefuture. This position is within the Simcenter Presales group, part of ourDigital Industries Software Business Unit.

Position overview:

As anApplication Engineer Modeling & Simulation you will act as the technicallead in demonstrating and promoting our Simcenter Simulation Solutions(primarily Simcenter Prescan) to our customers in a diverse range of industries,with primary focus on sophisticated driver assistance systems (ADAS) andautonomous vehicles (AV).

Thisexciting opportunity promoting innovative simulation solutions whilemaintaining a high level of technical knowledge offers a diverse range of skilldevelopment, from understanding the first principles of ADAS and AV Systems, todeveloping customer focused presentations, demonstrations, proof of conceptsand account leadership skills in support of our larger sales strategies.

Inthis position you will collaborate with the presales manager of ourfast-growing Simcenter Simulation and Test Solutions and be part of a largeteam of technical specialists, application and support engineers within theSiemens Digital Industries Software organization.

Responsibilities:

  • Work alongside the sales team to apply technical skills in the Simcenter Prescan portfolio, using a combination of application and domain expertise
  • Develops proof of concept models, provide demonstrations, and drives benchmarks using the Siemens Simcenter Simulation and Test Solutions portfolio
  • Collaborates with the product development roadmap by evaluating current product functionality, identifying customer needs, analyzing competitive products, analyzing and relaying customer requirements to the Siemens Simcenter product development team
  • Train and mentor client technical leads and domain authorities in the application of primarily Simcenter Prescan
  • Conduct technical discussions with customers to collect and understand simulation requirements, propose solutions, and explain benefits of our Simcenter portfolio
  • Join a community of highly skilled individuals maintaining professional and technical knowledge to stay at the forefront of innovation.

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

  • Master of Science in Automotive, Aerospace, Mechanical Engineering or other engineering team. Bachelor of Science with several years of shown experience will also be considered
  • Knowledge and experience using CAE simulation software
  • Strong interpersonal skills, communication skills and problem solving capabilities. Ability to work as an individual contributor and as a team member
  • Ability to travel up to 25%

QualifiedApplicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States.Qualified Applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization nowor in the future for employment in the United .

Preferred Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

  • Experience using World, Sensor and Vehicle Modeling tools: Simcenter Prescan, Matlab/Simulink, Simcenter Amesim, Simcenter Heeds, Polarion, IPG Carmaker, Applied Intuition, Carla, SUMO, dSpace Aurelion, Carsim/Trucksim,
  • Proficiency with C/C++ and/or Python
  • Understanding of the properties and technologies of the sensors used in automated and autonomous systems (Camera/Lidar/Radar/Ultrasonic/dGPS/V2X)
  • Knowledge of the ADAS/AD system design process, including the validation and verification (V&V) process, including SIL/MIL/HIL
  • Experience with 3D design tools (CAD / Blender / OBS Studio)
  • Experience in student projects such as SAE Formula Student, EcoCAR Mobility Challenge, GM AutoDrive Challenge, Indy Autonomous Challenge
  • Industry domain experience in one of the following areas: Automotive / Ground Vehicle, Aerospace / Defense, Industrial Machinery

Thetotal cash compensation range for this position is $76,300 to $152,600with 10% of this being comprised of an annual incentive target. Theactual compensation offered is based on the successful candidate's worklocation as well as additional factors, including job-related skills,experience, and relevant education/training. Siemens offers a variety of healthand wellness benefits to employees. Details regarding our benefits can be foundhere: www.benefitsquickstart.comIn addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Companypolicies, including paid sick leave paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exemptemployees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

AtSiemens, we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We needthe most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality.Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds
